Questions.Text: Which country is known as the "Land of the Rising Sun"?
Which country is home to the Great Barrier Reef?
What is the longest river in the world?
Mount Everest is located in which two countries?
Which desert is the largest in the world?
What is the difference between rational and irrational numbers?
Answers: Rational numbers cannot be expressed as fractions, while irrational numbers can.
Rational numbers can be written as fractions, while irrational numbers cannot.
Rational numbers are always integers, while irrational numbers are decimals.
There is no difference between rational and irrational numbers.

Questions.Text: What is the Pythagorean theorem, and in which type of triangle is it applicable?
Answers: The sum of the squares of the two shorter sides of a triangle is equal to the square of the longest side; it applies to all triangles.
The square of the hypotenuse equals the sum of the squares of the two legs; it applies to right triangles only.
The area of a triangle equals the sum of the squares of its three sides; it applies to isosceles
The sum of the interior angles of a triangle is always 180°; it applies to equilateral triangles.

Questions.Text: What is the Pythagorean theorem, and in which type of triangle is it applicable?
Answers: The sum of the squares of the two shorter sides of a triangle is equal to the square of the longest side; it applies to all triangles.
The square of the hypotenuse equals the sum of the squares of the two legs; it applies to right triangles only.
The area of a triangle equals the sum of the squares of its three sides; it applies to isosceles triangles.
The sum of the interior angles of a triangle is always 180°; it applies to equilateral triangles.

Questions.Text: What is the difference between permutations and combinations?
Answers: Permutations deal with the arrangement of objects, while combinations deal with the selection of objects without regard to order.
Permutations are always larger than combinations.
Combinations are always larger than permutations.
There is no difference between permutations and combinations.

Questions.Text: What is the concept of limits in calculus?
Answers: Limits represent the value that a function approaches as the input approaches a certain value.
Limits represent the maximum value that a function can reach.
Limits are only used for continuous functions.
Limits represent the average value of a function.

Questions.Text: Who was the first President of the United States?
In which year did World War II end?
The Titanic sank on its maiden voyage in which year?
Who was the famous queen of ancient Egypt?
The Berlin Wall fell in which year?
Which of the following is a synonym for "happy"?
What is the correct past tense of the verb "go"?
Choose the correctly punctuated sentence:
Answers: I love cooking, reading and writing.
I love cooking reading, and writing.
I love cooking, reading, and writing.
I love cooking reading and writing.

Questions.Text: Which of these is a compound sentence?
Answers: I went to the store and bought some apples.
I went to the store because it was raining.

Questions.Text: Which word is an adjective?
